snippet: Attempts at integration, including education at top universities, have had mixed results, leaving many North Koreans unable to adapt to South Korea’s hard-charging society.
abstract: Growing number of North Korean defectors who are making their way south are posing a greater challenge for South Korea; attempts at integration, including government-run crash courses on life in the capitalist South, have had mixed results, leaving many North Koreans unable to adapt to South Korea’s high-pressure society or overcome their stereotype as backward country cousins.
lead_paragraph: Attempts at integration, including education at top universities, have had mixed results, leaving many North Koreans unable to adapt to South Korea’s hard-charging society.

headline.seo: Young North Korean Defectors Struggle in the South
headline.main: Young North Korean Defectors Struggle in the South
headline.print_headline: North Korean Young Struggle in the South
